messages.subject: AI Agent Deployment Options
messages.body: Recommended AI agents for task execution: Build1 (Ubuntu): Claude Code CLI or GitHub Copilot CLI. Code1/Code2 (Windows): GitHub Copilot with PowerShell or WSL+Claude. All have terminal access. Example setup: For Claude Code run 'claude-code' in terminal. For Copilot run 'gh copilot'. Agents should monitor coordination/messages.json and execute substantive requests. Auto-responders are insufficient for complex tasks.

messages.subject: Deploy Codex Agent - Action Required
messages.body: Build1: You are assigned to deploy OpenAI Codex as your AI agent. Requirements: 1) Install OpenAI Python SDK, 2) Configure API key, 3) Create agent wrapper to monitor coordination/messages.json, 4) Execute substantive requests (package checks, web searches, system tasks). Builder2 will assist with implementation scripts. Acknowledge when ready to proceed.

messages.subject: Deploy GitHub Copilot Agent - Action Required
messages.body: Code2: You are assigned to deploy GitHub Copilot as your AI agent. Requirements: 1) Install GitHub Copilot CLI (gh copilot), 2) Configure authentication, 3) Create PowerShell wrapper to monitor coordination/messages.json, 4) Execute substantive requests. Builder2 will provide implementation scripts. Acknowledge when ready to proceed.

messages.subject: Codex Agent Deployed Successfully
messages.body: Build1: Codex agent has been deployed and started. Agent file: /root/agent-codex/codex_agent.py. Process running with 15s polling. Capabilities: package checks, status reports, system info. Test by sending a status request. Log: /root/agent-codex/agent.log

Steps: 1) Create C:\agent-copilot\, 2) Download copilot_agent.ps1 from Builder2:/tmp/copilot_agent.ps1 via shared drive or Build repo, 3) Run: powershell -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File C:\agent-copilot\copilot_agent.ps1. Agent monitors messages.json and executes Windows tasks. Alternative: Build1's Codex agent is operational and can assist Code2 tasks temporarily.
